Articles.Content: How far is a first Alpha from surfacing i would love these.

Maybe use the hook bay code from KAS? That would allow automatic alignment.

I second this too

Just use something like this on the rack :


MODULE
{
name = KASModulePartBay
bayType = KASPAR	   // Tag of the part allowed (add the line bayType = KASPAR in your payload KASModuleGrab too)
attachNode = top  // Name of the attach node of the Kaspar payload
sndStorePath = KAS/Sounds/kasparCoolSound  // Path of the store sound
}

For the KASPAR racks I'll see with Kospy, he may be interested in making an extension to his plugin that allows automatic attachment to stack attach points closest to the Kerbal. Or stack attach points that are specially tagged to accept KASPAR racks only. That would also ensure proper and precise placement without the need for micro-rotation management. For now in my cargo bays I am using surface attach so I have to position them properly and at right angles. Otherwise, at an oblique angle it works, but it looks ridiculous.

My part bay module already had a tag to accept or not a grabbed part depending of his tag (bayType).

I think the only thing missing for your 2.5m and 3.75m rack are the multiple bay support, but I planned to do it.

Meanwhile, you can already do a single rack for a payload without problem.
